name: cfspreadsheet
description: Read and writes Microsoft Excel spreadsheet files.

params.name: action
params.description:
read - Reads the contents of an XLS format file.
update - Adds a new sheet to an existing XLS file. You cannot use the update action to change a sheet in an existing file.
write - Writes a new XLS format file or overwrites an existing file.

params.name: autosize
params.description: CF11+ Toggles automatically ajusting the width of columns to accomodate their contents.

params.name: columns
params.description: Column number or range of columns. Specify a single number, a hypen-separated column range, a comma-separated list, or any combination of these; for example: 1,3-6,9.

params.name: excludeHeaderRow
params.description: CF9.0.1+ If set to true, excludes the headerRow from being included in the query results of a spreadsheet read..

params.name: filename
params.description: The pathname of the file that is written.

params.name: format
params.description: Format of the data represented by the name variable.

params.name: headerrow
params.description: Row number that contains column names.

params.name: name
params.description:
`action="read"` The variable in which to store the spreadsheet file data. You must specify name or query. If format="csv" then name will contain csv variable.
if format="html" then name will contain html content.
`action="write|update"` A variable containing CSV-format data or an ColdFusion spreadsheet object containing the data to write. You must specify name or query.

params.name: overwrite
params.description: A Boolean value specifying whether to overwrite an existing file.

params.name: password
params.description: Set a password for modifying the sheet.

params.name: query
params.description:
`action="read"` The query in which to store the converted spreadsheet file. You must specify format, name, or query.
`action="write|update"` A query variable containing the data to write. You must specify name or query.

params.name: rows
params.description: The range of rows to read. Specify a single number, a hypen-separated row range, a comma-separated list, or any combination of these. For example: 1,3-6,9.

params.name: src
params.description: The pathname of the file to read.

examples.title: Read an Excel file as variable
examples.description: Reads the Excel file in src into a variable provided in name.

examples.title: Read an Excel file as query (script syntax)
examples.description: Reads the Excel file in src into a coldfusion query variable provided in query using the first row as column names.
examples.code: cfspreadsheet( action="read", src=expandPath( 'example.xls' ), query="foo", headerrow=1, excludeHeaderRow=true );

examples.title: Write a spreadsheet
examples.description: Writes a query to an Excel file.
